name: Pickled and Fried Filipino Fish (Daing Na Bangus)
author: lola
summary: Bangus, or milkfish, is marinated in garlic and vinegar, dried and then fried Filipino-style. Serve with rice and mango relish.
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) whole milkfish (bangus), or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Cut a slit into the fish lengthwise along the back to remove gills, intestines, and innards
Spread open the fish to expose the flesh; pat dry all over
Lay fish flat on a ridged plate and sprinkle with salt and pepper
Spread garlic over the flesh and pour vinegar on top
Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator, 1 hour to overnight
Discard marinade and pat fish dry with paper towels
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Fry the fish until golden brown and crispy, 7 to 10 minutes
